messageBody:
On 7/28/06, Eko S.W. <swdev.bali@...> wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> If I was about to build a Web solution, is it easy to implement it using web
> unit testing framework?

There are many web application testing frameworks and utilities. Did
you have one in particular that you were thinking of using or did you
want advice or did you just wonder whether you should use one at all?

All testing is good.

The back end of a well designed web application will be testable using
straight JUnit. The front end should be tested using something
appropriate. Depending upon your budget and desire to code, that could
be anything from just using it yourself, to a set of scripts that
interact with the application via HTTP.

> And, ... << regarding the use of Spring Framework >> is there anyone here
> has the experience of doing it???

This is the JUnit mailing list. Perhaps that half of your question
might be more suited to a Spring mailing list or forum.
